author: George Orwell
review: George Orwell's dystopian masterpiece presents a chilling vision of a future where individuality is crushed under the boot of a totalitarian regime.

author: Harper Lee
review: Harper Lee's timeless novel explores themes of racial injustice and moral growth in the American South during the 1930s.

author: F. Scott Fitzgerald
review: F. Scott Fitzgerald's classic novel offers a portrait of the Jazz Age and a critique of the American Dream through the story of the enigmatic Jay Gatsby.

author: J.D. Salinger
review: J.D. Salinger's iconic novel captures the angst and alienation of adolescence through the rebellious and disillusioned Holden Caulfield.

author: Jane Austen
review: Jane Austen's beloved novel explores themes of love, class, and marriage in Regency-era England through the spirited Elizabeth Bennet and the enigmatic Mr. Darcy.

author: J.R.R. Tolkien
review: J.R.R. Tolkien's epic fantasy trilogy follows the journey of the hobbit Frodo Baggins as he seeks to destroy the One Ring and save Middle-earth from the dark lord Sauron.
